Class Stutter

java.lang.Object
  Stutter

 class Stutter
extends java.lang.Object

Stutter checks for repeat words in a text file. It prints a list of repeat words, by line number. Stutter will accept standard input or a list of file names.

Author:
Jeff Offutt, June 1989 (in C), Java version March 2003

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
main parses the arguments, decides if stdin or a file name, and calls Stut().

Parameters:
args - the command line arguments passed to Stutter
Throws:
java.io.IOException

stut

private static void stut(java.io.BufferedReader inFile)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Stut() reads all lines in the input stream, and finds words. Words are defined as being surrounded by delimiters as defined in the delimits[] array. Every time an end of word is found, checkDupes() is called to see if it is the same as the previous word.

Parameters:
inFile - the file being read to look for duplicates
Throws:
java.io.IOException

checkDupes

private static void checkDupes(int line)
checkDupes() checks to see if the globally defined curWord is the same as prevWord and prints a message if they are the same.

Parameters:
curWord - the current word
prevWord - the previous word

isDelimit

private static boolean isDelimit(char C)
Checks to see if a character is a delimiter.

Parameters:
c - is the character being sent into the function to be checked if it is in the delimit array
Returns:
value of false returns if c is not in the delimits array value of true is returned if it the character is contained in the array
